cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating west-north-west across the southwest Atlantic, then turning northwest toward the North Carolina/South Carolina coast late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern North Carolina coast (near Cape Fear-Cape Lookout)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern and mid-Atlantic U.S. coastline (NC–SC primary, VA–NJ secondary)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤11%) of sustained 34-kt winds late Friday; occasional gusts 30–40 mph possible if Florence’s remnants track northward.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the Delaware River terminals; only minor tidal anomalies possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate rain (1–3 inches) possible late Friday into Saturday if the moisture plume reaches New Jersey.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey shore beginning mid-week.
